alert.note: Alert for Nacogdoches; Shelby (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 22 at 5:54PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Texas, including the following counties, Nacogdoches, Panola, Rusk and Shelby. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 554 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Carthage, Tenaha, Timpson, Beckville, Joaquin, Deberry, Pinehill, Gary City, Woods, Paxton, Deadwood, Front, Dotson, Fairplay, Midyett, Stockman and Arcadia. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
